body.p:
J. F. Robinson, Pres't.
F. C. McCalla, Cash'r.
Office Farmers Bank of Kentucky
Georgetown, May 25 1861
My Dear Friend,

Good news for once! Your friend Col Boyd has paid the Ballance debt_ and I feel most gloriously relieved, dont you?_ I feel so happy this morning that I have resolved to allow nothing not even War to ruffle my temper any more -- tis so much more pleasant and agreeable to be always in a good humor -- --
But they would not pay any interest because the law excused them from that. -- I am so glad to get the principal that I can overlook the other without complaining. Good news isnt it?
